bibl.title: Joseph Walton v. L. C. Smith. Warrant of Arrest
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuits Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol 2

org.placeName: Ninth Judicial Circuit. Western District of Washington, Northern Division.

div1.p: State of Washington, Plaintiff vs. Joseph Walton, Defendant.
I hereby certify that by virtue of the within warrant, I arrested the within named defendant Joseph Walton.
LC Smith, Sheriff By T J McConey, Deputy. King County Washington
State of Washington, County of King. SS.
To the Sheriff or any Constable of said County

Whereas, K McKay has this day complained in writing, under oath, to the undersigned, one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County, that on the 31st day of Dec, 1905, in said County and State, Joseph Walton did commit the crime of Barbering on Sunday.
Therefore, in the name of the State of Washington, you are commanded forthwith to apprehend the said Joseph Walton and bring him before me to be dealt with according to law.
Given under my hand this 2nd day of July 1906
